page.title: 11TARO FAIR AT PETERSFIELD
page.content: Taro fair is held every year on the 6th October at the Heath. It is a noisy place with people laughing, shouting, screaming and yelling. There are lots of games, toys, rides and roundabouts. The things I like best are Touch-a-Bag and the Ghost Train. Some people like to buy candyfloss, which is all sticky and looks like cotton wool. There are games where you go up in a cage which is like a sort of lift and when you come down you sway. There are two or three roundabouts with animals on, like elephants, giraffes, monkeys and other sorts. The Ghost Train is all spooky and scarey. There are two or three sweet stalls which are full of sweets and candyfloss. There are hot dog stalls too. Everyone has a good time.
